summary: This document consists of email correspondence primarily between Cynthia Rodriguez and Jason Shames regarding the Butterfly Trust associated with Jeffrey Epstein. The emails discuss updates to the trust's beneficiaries and legal considerations regarding the trust's irrevocable status. The correspondence highlights the roles of both individuals in managing the trust and seeking legal opinions on its terms.

persons.name: Cynthia Rodriguez
persons.context: Cynthia Rodriguez is involved in managing the Butterfly Trust and is seeking legal guidance on amendments to the trust's beneficiaries.

persons.name: Jason Shames
persons.context: Jason Shames provides legal insights regarding the trust and its beneficiaries, responding to inquiries from Cynthia Rodriguez.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is identified as the settlor of the Butterfly Trust, which is the subject of the correspondence.

persons.name: Harry Beller
persons.context: Harry Beller is mentioned as one of the acting trustees for the Butterfly Trust.

persons.name: Erika Kellerhaus
persons.context: Erika Kellerhaus is mentioned as another acting trustee for the Butterfly Trust.

connections.description: Cynthia Rodriguez and Jason Shames work together at Deutsche Bank, with Cynthia seeking Jason's legal advice regarding the trust.
Cynthia Rodriguez manages the Butterfly Trust for Jeffrey Epstein, who is the settlor.
Harry Beller and Erika Kellerhaus are both acting trustees of the Butterfly Trust.

locations: 345 Park Avenue, New York, NY, USA
keyFacts: Cynthia Rodriguez is seeking legal guidance on the irrevocable status of the Butterfly Trust associated with Jeffrey Epstein.
The trust allows trustees to unilaterally amend beneficiaries without needing consent from all interested parties.
Harry Beller and Erika Kellerhaus are mentioned as acting trustees for the Butterfly Trust.
The correspondence includes discussions about the legal implications of changes to the trust's beneficiaries.
The document contains multiple emails dated from December 30, 2016, to February 2, 2017.
